data.comment: The big names in today's match at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium have now been confirmed.
The whistle has gone to start the match.
In the minute 1, Tottenham take a 1-0 lead thanks to Heung Min Son.
Harry Kane instrumental with a fine assist.
Throw-in Tottenham.
In the minute 4, It's getting dangerous! Free kick for West Ham close to the penalty box.
Aaron Cresswell of West Ham gets in a strike, but is off target.
Goal kick for Tottenham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
In the minute 7, West Ham have been awarded a corner by Paul Tierney.
West Ham's Michail Antonio breaks free at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. But the strike goes wide of the post.
Ball goes out of play for a Tottenham goal kick.
In the minute 8, Harry Kane puts the ball in the net and the home team extend their lead. The score-line now reads 2-0.
Great play from Heung Min Son to set up the goal.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
In the minute 10, Paul Tierney awards Tottenham a goal kick.
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to West Ham.
Throw-in high up the field for West Ham in London.
In the minute 13, Corner awarded to West Ham.
West Ham's Michail Antonio has run offside.
Goal! Tottenham increase their lead to 3-0 through a well-placed header from Harry Kane.
In the minute 16, Sergio Reguilon with an assist there.
Can Tottenham get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in West Ham's half?
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to Tottenham in their own half.
In the minute 20, Michail Antonio is booked for the away team.
Free kick for Tottenham in their own half.
Tottenham to take a throw-in in West Ham territory.
In the minute 22, Free kick in a good position for Tottenham!
Attention is being given to Tottenhamâ€™s Moussa Sissoko and play has been suspended briefly.
Moussa Sissoko has recovered and rejoins the match in London.
In the minute 26, Tottenham awarded a free kick in their own half.
Pablo Fornals of West Ham smashes in a shot on target. The keeper saves, though.
Tottenham have a goal kick.
In the minute 28, Free kick for Tottenham in their own half.
Paul Tierney awards the away team a throw-in.
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to Tottenham in their own half.
In the minute 31, Free kick for West Ham in the half of Tottenham.
Tottenham awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in for West Ham in the half of Tottenham.
In the minute 33, Tottenham needs to be cautious. West Ham have an attacking throw-in.
Tottenham's Heung Min Son is on target but unsuccessful.
West Ham have been awarded a corner by Paul Tierney.
In the minute 37, Tottenham's Harry Kane is whistled for offside at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
It's a goal kick for the home team in London.
Tottenham awarded a throw-in in their own half.
In the minute 40, Paul Tierney signals a West Ham throw-in in Tottenham's half.
Ball goes out of play for a Tottenham goal kick.
In London Tottenham attack through Steven Bergwijn. The finish is off target, however.
In the minute 42, Goal kick for West Ham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Free kick for West Ham in their own half.
West Ham have a dangerous throw-in.
In the minute 44, Michail Antonio of West Ham is pulled up for offside.
Can West Ham capitalize from this dangerous free kick?
The fourth official's board shows 2 minutes, which will be added to the 1st half.
In the minute 45, Tottenham have a goal kick.
The first-half is over.
The second-half has started.
In the minute 46, Paul Tierney signals a free kick to Tottenham in their own half.
Can West Ham get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Tottenham's half?
West Ham are pushing forward but Arthur Masuaku's finish is wide of the goal.
In the minute 48, It's a goal kick for the home team in London.
Ball safe as Tottenham is awarded a throw-in in their half.
West Ham attack but Pablo Fornals's header doesn't find the target.
In the minute 50, Paul Tierney awards Tottenham a goal kick.
Throw-in for West Ham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Tottenham are coming forward and Harry Kane gets in a strike, it misses the target, however.
In the minute 52, Ball goes out of play for a West Ham goal kick.
Corner awarded to West Ham.
Corner awarded to West Ham.
In the minute 54, Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) is given an opening but the shot is blocked by a defender.
Tomas Soucek (West Ham) goes for goal but the shot is blocked by an alert defence.
Paul Tierney signals a throw-in for West Ham, close to Tottenham's area.
In the minute 57, Throw-in for West Ham close to the penalty box.
Throw-in for Tottenham in their own half.
Tottenham awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 59, Throw-in for West Ham in their own half.
Can West Ham capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Tottenham's half?
Tottenham drives forward and Harry Kane gets in a shot. Without netting, however.
In the minute 62, Tottenham have been awarded a corner by Paul Tierney.
Corner awarded to Tottenham.
Tottenham to take a throw-in in West Ham territory.
In the minute 64, West Ham awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Tottenham drive upfield and Harry Kane gets in a shot. The strike is blocked by a West Ham defender.
Tottenham needs to be cautious. West Ham have an attacking throw-in.
In the minute 69, Throw-in for West Ham in the half of Tottenham.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
West Ham have been awarded a corner by Paul Tierney.
In the minute 71, West Ham have been awarded a corner by Paul Tierney.
West Ham will need to be alert as they defend a dangerous free kick from Tottenham.
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) has received a first yellow card.
In the minute 72, Jose Mourinho (Tottenham) is making a first substitution, with Gareth Bale replacing Steven Bergwijn.
Gareth Bale for Tottenham drives towards goal at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. But the finish is unsuccessful.
In the minute 73, Paul Tierney signals a West Ham throw-in in Tottenham's half.
Tottenham have a goal kick.
Harry Winks is replacing Tanguy Ndombele for Tottenham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Throw-in for Tottenham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
In the minute 76, It's a goal kick for the away team in London.
Free kick Tottenham.
Tomas Soucek (West Ham) has been booked and must now be careful not to get a second yellow card.
In the minute 77, West Ham make their first substitution with Andriy Yarmolenko replacing Michail Antonio.
The away team have replaced Pablo Fornals with Manuel Lanzini. This is the second substitution made today by David Moyes.
Free kick for West Ham in their own half.
In the minute 79, Tottenham drive into the zone and Harry Kane is presented with a brilliant opportunity. But his strike hits the upright!
Goal kick for West Ham at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
Manuel Lanzini for West Ham is whistled offside.
In the minute 80, Lucas Moura is on a sub for Heung Min Son for Tottenham.
West Ham awarded a free kick in their own half.
In London a free kick has been awarded the away team.
In the minute 82, Fabian Balbuena keeps West Hamâ€™s hopes alive with a headed strike to make it 3-1.
That's a fine assist from Aaron Cresswell.
Paul Tierney awards Tottenham a goal kick.
In the minute 85, Davinson Sanchez blunders with an own goal. This makes it 3-2.
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to West Ham in their own half.
Corner awarded to Tottenham.
In the minute 89, Free kick for West Ham in the half of Tottenham.
West Ham's Jarrod Bowen gets in a shot but it is blocked by a Tottenham defender.
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to Tottenham in their own half.
In the minute 89, Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) has received a yellow card from Paul Tierney.
Free kick for West Ham in their own half.
Paul Tierney will wait an extra 4 minutes before blowing the whistle to end the 2nd half.
Tottenham's Gareth Bale misses with an attempt on goal.
West Ham have a goal kick.
Paul Tierney awards the home team a throw-in.
Ball safe as West Ham is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Paul Tierney signals a free kick to West Ham just outside Tottenham's area.
Paul Tierney blows to end the match. The final score is 3-3.
The away team replace Arthur Masuaku with Robert Snodgrass.
Goal! West Ham go level at 3-3 through Manuel Lanzini in London.
Manuel Lanzini for West Ham has been booked by Paul Tierney and receives a first yellow card.
